chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Virginia R Lang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Any vehicled titled or registered in defendant's name are subject to IID as is the defendant herself.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to participate in and abide by all rules, terms, and conditrions of OWI Court.
Defendant must be in full compliance with driver's safety plan..
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

 If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: SERVE 9 months w/ remaining 90 days I&S for rules violations. With huber for work/treatment including AA if defendant qualifies. To begin at agent's discretion.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Virginia R Lang

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 3:24pm
State appears by ADA S.Brubacher.  Def appears in person/in custody and with Atty Richard Lawson.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW

State notes defendant has been accepted into OWI court.
State moves to:
Ct. 2 (OAR)>>D&RI
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (OWI 6th)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 6 years TOTAL WI State Prison: 3 years incarceration and 3 years ES, I&S; 3 years Probation, concurrent to any other probation.
CONDITIONS: Defendant to participate in and abide by all rules, terms and conditions of Marathon County OWI Court; 1 year MCJ -- defendant to serve 9 months with remaining 90 days I&S for any rules violations, w/huber for work/treatment including AA if defendant qualifies under jail classification system, w/credit for 52 days of time already served, to begin at discretion of PO; $600+CC including DNA surcharge; DNA sample; 3 year DL Rev w/credit; AODA; Absolute sobriety; Any vehicles titled and registered in the defendant's name are ordered to have IID installed and IID is ordered on defendant him/herself, both for a period of 3 years; IID to be installed within 14 days; $50 IID surcharge to be paid; Defendant must be in full compliance with driver's safety plan, IID order and DL rev order as conditions of probation.

>>If defendant revoked, defendant is eligible for SAP but is not eligible for CIP.

Adj: 3:37pm

Clerk Cheree
Case Called: 8:57am  
State appears by ADA S. Brubacher; Deft appears in person/in custody and with Atty Richard Lawson
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  

Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information filed.  Reading Waived.
Plea:  NOT GUILTY
Dates already set
Bond:  Continued

Adj: 9:00am

Preliminary Hearing at 01-20-2016 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference at 02-08-2016 08:30 am.

Shall not consume alcohol. No bars, taverns, liquor stores, or beer tents. No driving whatsoever. Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202-day report within 1 business days from release from jail.
